td.content: s:white M embalmer aged 55 years presents with moderate swelling and mild numbness of the left arm, moderate denial of any past history of surgery and intravenous drug use and moderate pain and swelling in left shoulder for 2 weeks. he denies smoking describes drinking an average of 12 beers a week for about 4 years in his past o:Height 167 cm, Weight 71.7 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17 a:Deep Venous Thrombosis p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed fondaparinux - 10 mg daily.

s:pt presents with moderate pain and swelling in left shoulder, moderate denial of any past history of surgery and intravenous drug use and moderate swelling and mild numbness of the left arm. pt is a 57 year old male. he consumes 2 drinks per night he denies smoking o:Height 166 cm, Weight 70.6 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16 a:Deep Venous Thrombosis p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed heparin - 5000 unit every 8 hours monitored IV infusion, and ordered Duplex US of leg, CBC, PT, PTT.
